alt: Blooming cactus plant and several smaller flowering plants nearby.
title: Flowers, including a blooming cactus, at the Desert Botanical Garden, Phoenix, Arizona. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

alt: Illustration of the fountain's center jet and tiered, color-lit basins. Chicago skyline in background.
title: Buckingham Fountain on Chicago's lake front. Poster by John Buczak, 1939.

alt: Overview of a walled flower garden with coastal landscape in background.
title: Gray Gardens, East Hampton, New York. Lantern slide by Frances B. Johnston and Mattie E. Hewitt, around 1914.

alt: Roses in several colors grow next to and around a lamp post.
title: Creative planting at the International Rose Test Garden in Portland, Oregon. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 2018.

alt: A white boy wearing shorts and a tie uses a watering can to moisten several rows of vegetables.
title: Children's school victory gardens, New York City. Photo by Edward Meyer, 1944.

alt: Four African American children pose while standing in front of flowers by a fence.
title: Henry Truvillion's children (4 of the 5), in his flower garden, Newton, Texas. Photo by Ruby Lomax, 1940.

alt: Smiling scarecrow stands among vegetables in a small fenced garden.
title: Worker vegetable garden with scarecrow at the National Cash Register Company, Dayton, Ohio.  Lantern slide, around 1905.

alt: Blooming flowers flank a gravel path with stone steps leading to a wooden gate and arbor.
title: Flower garden gate at Beechgate, Englewood, New Jersey.  Lantern slide by Frances B. Johnston, 1918.

alt: Woman wearing a flower-patterned dress, is stretched out on a bench with her shoes off.
title: Government employee taking a nap on a bench in the Botanical Garden, Washington, DC. Photo by John Ferrell, 1942.

alt: Low dirt walls surround sunken rows of plants with a  desert landscape in background.
title: Gardens surrounding the Zuni Pueblo, in which are raised a variety of vegetables.  Stereograph by Timothy O'Sullivan, 1873.

alt: Corner of stone house with blooming yellow and purple plants in foreground.
title: Bartram's Garden, America's oldest botanical garden, Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

alt: Crescent-shaped pool with garden park at left and skyscrapers in background.
title: Reflecting pool, Yerba Buena Gardens, atop Moscone Convention Center, San Francisco, California. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

alt: Stone pathway and low-growing flowers lead into a wooded area.
title: Pathway at Reef Point, Beatrix Farrand house, Bar Harbor, Maine. Lantern slide by Frances B. Johnston, 1920.

alt: A row of four men wearing aprons stand by potted plants; two are smiling.
title: Japanese American men work in a greenhouse operated by the Issei-owned Ozone Park Nursery, New York City. Photo by Stone S. Ishimaru, 1945.

alt: Site plan identifies trees, plants, and two houses.
title: Adams Garden, Quincy, Massachusetts. Delineated by Margaret M. Webster, 1936.

alt: Bird's-eye view illustration of the courtyard, gardens, and large fountain surrounded on three sides by the palace.
title: Paris. Jardin du Palais Royal. Lithograph by Lemercier from drawing by Philippe Benoist, around 1850.

alt: Frozen fountain in front of the monument with a sculpture of Washington on a horse.
title: George Washington Monument and frozen fountain, Richmond, Virginia. Stereograph by David H. Anderson, 1860-1870.

alt: Many children and adults (seen from behind) are looking at the two-tier fountain with multiple water jets.
title: Forsyth Park fountain, Savannah, Georgia. Stereograph by J.N. Wilson, 1860-1880.

alt: Potted plants flank a walkway inside a greenhouse.
title: Botanical Gardens, Washington, DC, approximately 1880.

alt: People look across a pond to the three-story museum building.
title: Kew Gardens, the museum, England, 1890-1900.

alt: A rectangular pool of water leads to the elaborate fountain with sculpture figures.
title: Luxembourg Gardens, the Medici fountain, Paris, France, 1890-1900.

alt: Plants grow in water with the wooden porch of a building at left.
title: Water garden, China. Lantern slide by William Henry Jackson, 1895.

alt: Design drawing for a octagonal basin with decorative figures in blue, yellow, red, and green.
title: Basin for fountain in the Winter Garden at Biltmore, Asheville, North Carolina. Drawing by Richard M. Hunt, around1895.

alt: More than 12 children and a teacher are in a narrow, fenced garden.
title: Kindergarten in a vegetable garden, Washington, DC. Photo by Frances B. Johnston, 1899.

alt: View across a valley with a few trees and buildings.
title: Garden of Gethsemane, Jerusalem. Stereograph, 1900.

alt: The heads of two children appear just above the flowers that fill a field.
title: A spring day in the Kabota iris gardens--children playing among the tall flower stalks, Omori, Japan. Stereograph by Underwood & Underwood, 1905.

alt: Men row in a boat in front of a multi-story, pyramid-shaped pagoda and palm trees.
title: Buddhist pagoda in the Burmese style, Eden Gardens, Calcutta (now Kolkata), India. Stereograph by American Stereoscopic Co., 1907.

alt: A large statue of a standing man with flowers in the foreground.
title: Statue of Linnaeus, Humelgard Park, Stockholm, Sweden. Stereograph by Standard Scenic Co., 1907.

alt: A man sits on the porch of a one-story log cabin with a yard filled with flowers and vegetables.
title: A cottage & garden, Alaska. Photo by National Photo Co., 1909-1920.

alt: Girls and boys pose by plants in wooden boxes on a roof.
title: Roof garden, Elizabeth McCormick open air school, Hull House Chicago, 1912.

alt: Wide grass pathway flanked by blooming flowers.
title: Flower garden, Mariemont, Middletown, Rhode Island. Lantern slide, by Frances B. Johnston and Mattie E. Hewitt, 1914.

alt: Several doves perch on top of a triangular birdhouse surrounded by a white flowering bush.
title: Dovecote, Gray Gardens, East Hampton, New York. Lantern slide by Frances B. Johnston and Mattie E. Hewitt, around 1914.

alt: Several people sit and stand in front of thick bamboo stems that tower above them.
title: Immense bamboos of the world-famed botanical gardens, Buitenzorg (now Bogor), Java. Stereograph by Underwood & Underwood, 1915.

alt: Rooftop garden filled with flower plants and vines.
title: Penthouse on a skyscraper, New York City. Photo by Bain News Service, 1919.

alt: Rows of red tulips with a tree and other flowers in the background.
title: Tulip garden in the Washington, DC, area. Photo by Theodor Horydczak, around 1940s.

alt: A circular pond in the foreground and a rose-covered wall and seating in the background.
title: Fountain in pool at The Dunes, East Hampton, New York. Lantern slide by Frances B. Johnston and Mattie E. Hewitt, around 1915.

alt: Technical diagram for a large circular fountain.
title: Foundation plan for James Scott Memorial Fountain, Belle Isle, Detroit, Michigan. Design by architect Cass Gilbert, 1920.

alt: Many children are playing in the ground-level water jets and on two animal sculptures.
title: Sculpture and children in fountains - Jane Addams Houses, Chicago. Photo by Peter Sekaer, 1938-1940.

alt: Blooming plants overflow a window box on the first floor of a brick residential building.
title: Flowers in a window, New York City. Photo by Walker Evans, 1938.

alt: Potted plants fill the sill of a curtained window.
title: Plants in window of Nebraska farmhouse. Photo by John Vachon, 1938.

alt: Tall flowers along a fence with a two-story house in the background
title: Picket fence near Faribault, Minnesota. Photo by John Vachon, 1941.

alt: Illustration shows a shower of blue water over five vegetables, shown above and below ground.
title: Grow it yourself: Plan a farm garden now. Poster by Herbert Bayer, 1941-1943.

alt: In a large display of vegetable seeds a woman's hand reaches for a packet of corn.
title: Greenbelt, Maryland. Buying vegetable seeds in the Greenbelt variety store 1942.

alt: Older white man poses while holding vegetables pulled from a row of the garden.
title: Citizen working on Sunday morning in his victory garden, Oswego, New York. Photo by Marjory Collins, 1943.

alt: Birdbath with fountain jet spouting through a fish tail.
title: Bird bath, U.S. Naval Hospital, San Diego, California. Photo by Edward Gohlich, 1985.

alt: A replica of the Statue of Liberty sits atop a mound decorated by rocks of different colors.
title: Petersen's Rock Garden, Statue of Liberty monument, Redmond, Oregon. Photo by John Margolies, 1987.

alt: Man with a watering can is in a garden with a house and wooded hillside in background.
title: Bob Jarrell's vegetable garden, West Virginia. Photo by Mary Hufford, 1996. American Folklife Center.

alt: Wooden chair by a stone wall overlooks blooming flowers and a low waterfall.
title: Detail of a garden in Virginia. Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, around 2000.

alt: Blooming flowers and pond with a fountain appear in front of the large conservatory.
title: Pond and conservatory at Hershey Gardens, Hershey, Pennsylvania.  Photo by Carol M. Highsmith, 2019.
